a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Projected change in dependency ratio depending on labor force
– Age dependency is the ratio between people defined as dependents (under-15s and over-65s) and working-age people.
– Labor force dependency does not take into account age brackets but instead uses the ratio between those not participating
in the workforce to those that are.
– High labor force participation assumes a higher share of people participating in the workforce (e.g. beyond the age of 65).
Data source: European Commission and IIASA, 2020
Note: Values are indexed to 100 in 2015 to compare differences over time.
